data.title: Best Chinese in the Vegas valley
data.text: This is, by far, our favorite Chinese restaurant in Henderson, and Las Vegas. Not just take out, or inexpensive places, but any of the restaurants we've tried. And that's more than a few! It's not much to look at, and there isn't a large seating area, but don't let that turn you away! The food is excellent - and lots of it! If you get the lunch special, it's enough for at least two meals. The lo mein, veggie egg foo young, and garlic chicken are all favorites. As is the Mongolian beef if you like it hot! But the pot stickers are my favorites!

data.title: Cater lunch for work
data.text: We ordered five choices from the catering menu they came with free rice the chicken and beef dishes were really good we did not get enough rice I called China a gogo and they ran over additional rice and egg rolls is their way of saying we're sorry I was really happy with the food and the service overall we have a lot of leftovers the portion sizes very generous

data.title: Greasy and cheap
data.text: I'm not a big fan of China a Go Go (I call it China a No No), but most of the people I know like it. To me, it's large portions of greasy Chinese food for cheap. So if you like tons of cheap Chinese food, then by all means this is the place for you.

data.title: Finally, a good clean chinese restaurant
data.text: Although they seem to be tucked away, they are in the same shopping center with Albertson's.  This location is brand new and they are doing a pretty good job of keeping up with the flood of customers.  The food is very good and the prices are reasonable.

data.title: Birthday Sushi
data.text:
I had lunch here a week ago and I really enjoyed it. We had three sushi rolls, and a boba slush. Everything was very tasty, which is saying something because I am a pretty picky sushi eater. 

Prices were about average, neither on the very expensive, or very cheap end. 

Service was fine, they were not overly friendly, or otherwise. It was overall a pleasant dining experience.

data.title: Catered lunch for 27
data.text: I ordered the party plater for 24, 6 entries as seen on web site. The price varies, grub hub quotes $210, another site $180. I paid the higher price but the food was worth it. Got spicy garlic chicken (my favorite) spicy Mongolian beef, very good, beef and string beans, the groups favorite, chicken chow mien, yummy! Orange chicken, a classic and egg roles served with white and fried rice. Also added a veggie with tofu dish for my vegetarian guests. Very good lunch, enough for 40 people we had leftovers at work for two more days!

data.title: We eat here a few times a month
data.text: Great food. We get the Singapore noodles. It has more spice than most Singapore noodles from other places, but it is still great. We also get sweet n sour or general taos to share. They have good crab Rangoon and rice. They offer all u can eat sushi. Highly recommend.

data.title: Good fast food chinese
data.text: The menu has a lot, the prices are fair. the service is fast and the sushi is pretty darn good for take out sushi. BBQ ribs are excellent.

data.title: Pleased
data.text:
We ate Chinese and were very pleased with the food.    Portions were large and very tasty. Service was faster than I expected,   All items from soup to main course were served within a minute of each other.  In the future, I want the main meal after I finish the soup.

Small location in a shopping center.    Good value for your dollar.
